New Records: The Phillies set a new season high for runs scored with 16.
Johan Rojas became the first Phillie this season to double three times in the same game.
Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler delivered six superb innings, allowing just one run and striking out seven.
Trea Turner hit his 16th homer in the Phils’ four-run second inning.
J.T. Realmuto exited in the fourth inning with a left knee contusion.
The Phillies’ offense racked up 22 hits, a season high.
Pre-Game Insights: The Marlins’ starter, Edward Cabrera, was scratched an hour before the first pitch with migraine-like symptoms.
Post-Match Reflections: Zack Wheeler expressed that winning a Cy Young Award would mean a lot to him.
Manager Rob Thomson praised Wheeler's command and decision to not extend him beyond six innings due to the large lead.
Trea Turner highlighted the importance of contributions from the entire lineup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies extended their win streak to six games for the first time since May 17-23.
